technology.short_description: Cathayan horses are no less flighty than their otherwise inferior Old World kin, but an expert rider knows that bestowing stillness upon their anxious steed is paramount to victory.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Cavalry units
Charge bonus: +10% for Cavalry units

technology.short_description: Special rewards in recognition of Zhao Ming's achievements. This technology costs 4000 gold to research.

As all his siblings, Zhao Ming has many titles and nicknames, and this one is the most used by foreigners for very good reasons as his envoys and traders travel far and wide in search of trade goods, making contacts and learning everything they can about possible allies and certain enemies.

effects.description:
Lord Recruit Rank +3 to Caravan Masters
	(factionwide)
Diplomatic Relations +15 with Ogre Kingdoms, Dwarfs, Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms

Ambush defence chance: +15%
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: The best caravan masters, pathfinders and cartographers are recruited to teach all they have learned about foreign lands to Cathayan army officers.

effects.description:
Immunity to Mountain Pass, Desert, Swamp, and Barren Wasteland attrition 
	(all armies)

Weapon Strength: +5% when besieging
	(all armies)

Ambush success chance: +5%
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Unlike most of his siblings, Zhao Ming understands and appreciates that many of his soldiers share a bond stronger than steel after having served together for a long time, patrolling the desert or scorting caravans for months. Thus, he makes sure they can enjoy the best food and booze after returning from their missions.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Rowdy" for Imperial Road Watch, Imperial Road Watch (Spears), Frontier Guards (Spears), Frontier Guards (Swords), Frontier Guards (Bows) units
	(all armies)

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

technology.short_description: Zhao ming he has learned through travellers and caravan traders that the Empire of Sigmar and the Dwarfs have made great advancements in gunmaking technology. And now, his alchemists and artisans work with handsomely paid Engineers from those lands to make maybe the best rifles in the world.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Hawkish Precision" for Crane Gunners units
	(all armies)

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Extra Powder" for Iron Hail Gunners, Artillery, and Balloon units
	(all armies)

Anti-Infantry Bonus: +8 for all Imperial Road Watch Rifle, and Frontier Guard Rifle units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: The Dragon Empress has gifted his favourite son the secrets of forging the metal fallen from the stars and the Moon and his Alchemists have been able to combine it with the strange ores found in the deserts to create new weapons and armours.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +8% for Jade Warriors, Jade Lancers, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warriors (Spears), Golden Lancers, Great Longma Riders, Great Moon Bird, Celestial Dragon Guards, and Celestial Dragon (Swords) units
	(all armies)

Barrier: +800 for Jade Warriors, Jade Lancers, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warriors (Spears), Golden Lancers, Great Longma Riders, Great Moon Bird, Celestial Dragon Guards, and Celestial Dragon (Swords) units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: It is the Jade Warriors who keep the great cities of Cathay safe, but they are too gracious to demand promotion. Thus, we must identify and raise up their finest ourselves.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10% for Gate Masters
Hero capacity: +2 for Gate Masters
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Gate Masters
Recruit rank: +1 for Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units
Missile resistance: 10% for Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units

technology.short_description: Every Spirit Qilin yearns to return to the Celestial Mountains, and have been known to depart for them even in the heat of battle. Incanting a Yang rite upon their reins will ensure obedience.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +20 for Great Longma Riders units

technology.short_description: The school of Feng Shi sorcery, named for the Dragon Emperor himself, grants strength and protection to all those who wield it. It is the highest honour to march beneath the Yang banner.

effects.description: Upkeep: -4% for Yang units

items.colour_text: An ancient banner doused in the sorcerous power of the Dragon Emperor himself, granting strength and protection.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: It takes time for a newly-awakened Sentinel to regain its full might, as it sheds the moss and earth of years, but the correct incantations will instantly purge all such detritus.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Terracotta Sentinel units
Weapon strength: +4% for Wu Xing War Compass, Zhangu War Drum, Jade Lion, Jet Lion and Terracotta Sentinel units
Missile resistance: 10% for Terracotta Sentinel units

technology.short_description: The Moon Empress can take any form, and it is thanks to her time spent running with the herds, free as the wind, that we may now learn the language of horses.

effects.description: Melee defence: +3 for Cavalry units
Charge bonus: +10 for Peasant Horsemen and Jade Lancers units

technology.short_description: As majestic as jade, as unbreakable as stone: this what every devoted warrior of Cathay, whether born to power or peasantry, must eternally strive to be.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds) and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: Down to the lowliest middle-managers, every servant of the Emperor must work towards the common goals of good fortune and prosperity for every Cathayan soul.

effects.description:
Growth: +10
	(all provinces)
Income from Industry (Yang) buildings: +15%

technology.short_description: Stillness of the mind and soul are virtues to which we all must aspire. Only with impeccable discipline and balance may we truly prevail against wickedness.

effects.description: Income from sacking settlements: +10%

technology.short_description: Once freed from doubt, fear and distrust, their minds governed only by their absolute devotion to the Dragon Emperor, the Celestial legion shall move like the Eight Winds themselves.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Yang units

technology.short_description: Yang is the strength of the soul. Yang is the flame in the heart and the fire in our veins. Yang is the roar from the lungs. Yang is the iron within our bones and the stone beneath our skins.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Yang units

technology.short_description: The Dragon Emperor's Celestial fire burns hotter than all else. Bricks baked in the Burning Wind emerge strong and flawless, all the better to build great monuments to Xen Yang.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Yang infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: The Celestial Dragon will raise us all up – we need only to heed His wisdom. And so, by tapping the flame within their souls, the Dragon Emperor's soldiers shall become tireless.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for Yang characters
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Yang units

technology.short_description: So well-drilled are the Jade Lancers of Cathay, and so fluid their steeds, that they could outflank their enemy even within the narrowest of alleyways.

effects.description: Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Jade Lancers units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

technology.short_description: The Dragon Emperor sees all, and so it is that an infusion of His Celestial magic can grant sight beyond sight to His most loyal believers.

effects.description: Ward save: 5% for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units

technology.short_description: In public, all obey the Dragon Emperor without question, but in private many provinces vie for independence and power. Those who serve Him faithfully shall be rewarded.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +50%
	(all characters)

items.colour_text: Blessed by his Celestial Majesty Xen Yang, this banner is imbued with great power.

effects.description:
Ward save: 15%
	(assigned unit)

Weapon strength: +5%
	(assigned unit)

technology.short_description: Rare crystals litter the peaks of Kunlan, each of which absorbed a fragment of the Celestial energy unleashed by the Dragon Emperor's birth. Once socketed into an anvil, divine armour may be forged.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Celestial Dragon Guard and Celestial Dragon Crossbows units

technology.short_description: But a word from the Sea Dragon is all that is required to grant passage or permit. We may also petition her for aid in constructing coastal defences, for what is the ocean but another bastion?

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Ports
Construction time: -2 for Ports
Income from faction capital settlement: +50%

technology.short_description: Harmony brings unity, and unity brings efficiency. The warriors of wind and field must be taught to trust one another implicitly, for each is an extension of the Dragon Emperor's will, fighting as one.

effects.description: Construction cost: -2% for all buildings
Recruit rank: +1 for Peasant Long Spearmen units
Leadership: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen units

technology.short_description: Cathay's provincial troops are loyal and numberless, but they are crude and unrefined soldiers. There is such great potential in them, waiting only to be unlocked.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10%

Corruption: -1
	(all provinces)
Melee attack: +4 when attacking

technology.short_description: A system of bellows and fine brass funnels ensures that escaped heat is recaptured and reused rather than wasted, thus granting greater lift and range for our Sky Lanterns.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Sky Lantern units

technology.short_description: All the world envies Cathay's most grandiose technologies, but it is in the smallest of things, such as cogwheels no larger than a hummingbird's eye, that we truly innovate.

effects.description: Range: +5% for Celestial Dragon Crossbows, Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +3 for Celestial Dragon Crossbows, Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units

technology.short_description: So numerous are the warriors of wind and field that it is impossible to keep a tally of the wounded, but learned physicians can at least identify the most grievously harmed.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Peasant Long Spearmen, Peasant Archers, and Peasant Horsemen units

technology.short_description: If the great magnets within a War Compass are suddenly inverted, they will repulse incoming fusillades, scattering missiles like blossom on the breeze.

effects.description: Attribute: 360 Missile Block for Wu Xing War Compass units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +40% for Wu Xing War Compass units

technology.short_description: With Celestial fire coursing through their veins, quaffed without hesitation from a jade goblet, the Dragon Emperor's honour guard shall never again know fatigue.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% for Celestial Dragon Guard and Celestial Dragon Crossbows units

technology.short_description: Retired Gate Masters – with the Dragon Emperor's tacit approval – often train underworld denizens in the ways of the Jade Warriors. In this way, even criminals are taught balance.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

technology.short_description: Some say meditation is relaxation. This is a grave misconception, for Yang meditation amplifies the will and dampens all need. Its most capable practitioners can go days without rest or fodder.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Yang units

technology.short_description: The Dragon Emperor's Celestial hand shall ease our path, no matter what might assail us on the way. All we need do is look for His radiance, and follow after it.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for Yang characters
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Yin units

technology.short_description: A drying process, taught by an Ogre Butcher outcast from his tribe due to too many vegetable-based recipes, strengthens peasants' makeshift armour without rendering it brittle.

effects.description:
Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(all provinces)
Armour: +10 for Peasant Horsemen units

technology.short_description: The people cannot protest against the Jade Dragon's law if they are paid in the Jade Dragon's coin.

effects.description: Leadership: +8 for Peasant Long Spearmen and Peasant Horsemen units

technology.short_description: The House of Secrets refuses to disclose quite which reagents have been added to the mixture, but there is no denying that it builds sturdy structures at minimal cost.

effects.description: Construction cost: -5% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Every soul in the Celestial Empire, no matter how low-born, is deserving of the Dragon Emperor's care. It falls to Yuan Bo, the Jade Dragon, to share His purse amongst the commonfolk.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -4% for Peasant Long Spearmen, Peasant Archers and Peasant Horsemen units

technology.short_description: There are those who obtain status through ignoble means, and there are those who debase their heraldry. Fortunately, true Dragon-blooded may replace them at a whim.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

Lord recruit rank: +4 for Caravan Masters
	(factionwide)

Lord recruit rank: +3
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: By putting ego to one side and working together, there is no limit to the innovations the outcast Sorcerers of the House of Secrets might devise.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10% for Astromancers
Hero capacity: +2 for Astromancers
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Astromancers

technology.short_description: It is said that each stone sentinel sings a constant and divine song of purification, sadly inaudible to all those not born of Dragon-blood.

effects.description:
Corruption: -2
	(all provinces)
Control: +1
Armour: +10 for Jade Lion, Jet Lion and Celestial Lion units
Speed: +10% for Jade Lion, Jet Lion and Celestial Lion units

technology.short_description: Yin-Yin rules over the Jade Sea and far beyond, and it is she who keeps Cathay's ports safe from crime and corruption. Only by the Sea Dragon's grace is fresh trade allowed or disallowed.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +5%
Income from faction capital settlement: +50%
Income from Ports: +10%

technology.short_description: The great inventions of the City of Smoke generate more wealth than most other empires put together. We are fortunate indeed that it shares its technologies with us.

effects.description: Income from Industry: +8%

technology.short_description: The House of Secrets skirts the edges of morality and legality, but a carefully-worded edict would further legitimise its renegade wizards. In turn, it would share its best and brightest with us.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10% for Alchemists
Hero capacity: +2 for Alchemists
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Alchemists

technology.short_description: It is on the backs of the hard-working commonfolk that every noble of Cathay stands, and it is past time they were shown gratitude. Send forth for the finest dishes in all the Celestial Empire!

effects.description: Armour: +25 for Zhangu War Drum units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +200 for Zhangu War Drum units

technology.short_description: Every child of Cathay is taught to fear the Great Enemy, but as adulthood descends, so too does temptation grow. Mandatory re-education and thrice-daily prayer to the Dragon Emperor is thus required.

effects.description: Leadership: +10 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: A single brass lever activates thousands of pulleys, arranged in a dense lattice even the most brilliant of minds could not untangle, and quickly drags the Compass into shuddering arrangement.

effects.description: Wu Xing Compass cooldown: -1 turns

technology.short_description: By harnessing the magic of Azyr, Xen Yang may divine what is to come, and thus He shall know the hour of our need. When He tells His faithful that hour has not yet come, they shall believe Him.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
	(all armies)
Recruit rank: +1
Hero and Lord recruit rank: +5

technology.short_description: Because the Moon Empress blesses every arrow in the Celestial Empire, it is contingent upon our fletchers to construct them with the utmost care, and our archers to not waste even a single shot.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +2% for Peasant Long Spearmen, Peasant Archers, and Peasant Horsemen units
Ammunition: +10% for Peasant Archers, Celestial Dragon Crossbows and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: As the moon's silver light washes over us, Quai Yin shall grant Her blessing. Darkness shall hone our blades, and shadows shall form our armour.

effects.description: Enemy Hero action success chance: -20%
Armour: +2 for Peasant Long Spearmen units
Melee defence: +4 when defending

technology.short_description: The Dragon Emperor has seen countless species rise and fall, and can teach us much of them. The ancient Chelonian turtles possessed nigh-unbreakable shells – this, we can recreate with wood and steel.

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Peasant Long Spearmen units
Melee defence: +5 for Peasant Long Spearmen units

technology.short_description: The grand artificers of Cathay's impregnable heart of industry are capable of creating weapons reputedly as everlasting as the Great Bastion itself.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Jade Warriors (Halberds), Celestial Dragon Guard and Celestial Dragon Crossbows units
Weapon strength: +5% for Jade Warriors (Halberds), Celestial Dragon Guard and Celestial Dragon Crossbows units

technology.short_description: What the warriors of wind and field might lack in formal training they make up for with the wily skills of born hunters.

effects.description: Attribute: Stalk for Peasant Archers units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: The cloak of darkness is merely a state of mind to which only a few are attuned, enabling them to move unseen and unheard even in the broadest daylight.

effects.description: Ambush success chance: +20%
Ambush defence chance: +20%

technology.short_description: By augmenting each missile's tip with shards of the Celestial Dragon's most favoured stone, they shall become able to pierce even the strongest steel.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +3 for Celestial Dragon Crossbows units

technology.short_description: The Terracotta Sentinels are ancient indeed, but the Celestial Court believes it can recreate the invocations Xen Yang used to infuse their stone forms with a semblance of life so long ago.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Terracotta Sentinel units
Armour: +4 for Terracotta Sentinel units

technology.short_description: The Moon Empress weeps for every fallen child of Cathay. For this reason, she has been known to walk amongst those who follow her creed, disguised as a peasant healer, tending to the wounded and dying.

effects.description:
Immune to Chaos Wastes attrition
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: "Strike fast, strike hard, no mercy" is a fine mantra, but futile should the enemy feel similarly. Defence is of equal import, and uncannily lightweight alchemical steel shall provide it.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units

technology.short_description: Patience, planning and practice: obey these tenets always, and we shall move as the night wind – silent, graceful and unimpeded by any obstacle.

effects.description:
Corruption: -2
	(all provinces)
Income from Industry (Yin) buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: True balance requires the trust and participation of all souls. Only when we think and work as one will absolute harmony of purpose be achieved.

effects.description: Income from Cities: +5%

technology.short_description: The Moon Empress shall bind our foes in tendrils of night, and in balance her kiss shall grant our bows new strength.

effects.description: Base missile damage: +10% for Yin units

technology.short_description: Our legion can learn to draw from within themselves an invisible miasma of the Moon Empress' enduring love, which as it envelops our foes shall blunt their every strike.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Yin units

technology.short_description: Previously unseen beyond the Forests of the Moon, a pitch-black tree which yields lumber as tough as fresh-forged iron has spread to the slopes of Kunlan – no doubt with Quai Yin's blessing.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Yin infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: To drink of purest Yin energy, filtered from the silver waters of the Dragon River, is to become as swift and weightless as a spirit, unbound by corporeal convention.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10% for Yin characters

technology.short_description: The Ogre merchants of the Ivory Road charge a pretty penny to have their trained Giants stomp on our cannon wadding, but the compressed results can be loaded with incredible speed.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Grand Cannon units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Grand Cannon units

technology.short_description: Some mistake darkness for wickedness. Those who worship Quai Yin know that, in truth, darkness is purity, and to give themselves to the peace of night will answer their every need.

effects.description: Leadership: +8 for Yin units

technology.short_description: Great feats of archery, great deeds of subterfuge, great acts of charity: this is how the Moon Dragon's blessed favour is won.

effects.description: Speed: +15% for Peasant Archers, Celestial Dragon Crossbows and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen units
Bonus vs Infantry: +6 for Onyx Crowmen and Great Moon Bird units

items.colour_text: Those that loose their arrows under this banner blessed by the Empress gain unerring accuracy.

effects.description:
Range: +20%
	(assigned unit)

Attribute: Stalk
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: When its powder is laced with deadly Warpstone, courtesy of the House of Secrets' e'er-scheming Alchemists, each fresh Fire Rain rocket can be produced for a fraction of its former cost.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Fire Rain Rocket units
Ammunition: +25% for Fire Rain Rocket units

technology.short_description: Come the next rainstorm, a system of canals and reservoirs can capture and share the Dragon River's over-spilling, mystic waters far and wide. And thus, the Yin shall flow.

effects.description: Sale value of cargo: +25%

technology.short_description: The Moon Empress loves every child of Cathay dearly, but she most favours those who show fealty to the elemental winds of shadow and spirit.

effects.description: Upkeep: -4% for Yin units

items.colour_text: The Moon Empress sets her own conventions. Chief amongst these is the ability to pass without being noticed whenever she chooses…

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: A criss-crossing of miniature blades within the gun barrel's interior scores hundreds of vicious edges into every piece of shot. Only Nan-Gau's most diligent artificers can achieve this feat.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +2 for Iron Hail Gunner units

technology.short_description: Vermillion Warbird hatchlings, before they reach full and fiery maturity, may be used as spotters, scattering harmless dancing flames in the vicinity of Crane Gunners' distant targets.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Crane Gunners units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +8% for Crane Gunners units

technology.short_description: Absolute discipline. Perfect alignment of purpose. Every soldier knowing their place. This is the Harmony of Stone and Steel.

effects.description: Armour: +2 for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units
Leadership: +4 when defending
Melee defence: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units

technology.short_description: A fresh edict: only those born to a family which has known no short-sightedness or blindness for five generations may wield a Jade crossbow. Even then, they must prove themselves.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units
Ammunition: +20% for Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units

technology.short_description: When not dousing the Dragon Emperor's foes in purifying flame, the Dragon Fire Throwers mounted upon a Sky-Junk's perimeter can belch their emissions towards the craft's rear, further increasing thrust.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for Sky-junk units
Ammunition: +20% for Sky-junk units
Missile strength: +8% for Sky-junk units
